title: [K-12] Augmented Reality-Based Science Learning Media Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific knowledge and experience with digital media applications
context.additional_context: Program for pre-service teachers to master science learning content creation using augmented reality (AR) technology. Conducted via mobile device-based microlearning in BYOD environments

learning_goals: AR-based learning media can be designed following the five phases of the ADDIE model (Analysis-Design-Development-Implementation-Evaluation)
AR interactive content themed on historical scientific and cultural heritage can be produced
The practicality of AR learning media can be verified by applying user experience (UX) evaluation criteria

resources: AR Development Tool (Unity/Unreal Engine Educational License)
Access to Digital Archive of Scientific Cultural Heritage

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
